intro: Diplospora tinagoensis, commonly known as the tinago shrub, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a hairy texture. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native environment.
